page.title: 16 Heritage trail Otley
page.content: As part of the Godspeed celebrations in 1985 a heritage trail was devised in and around Otley . Several important buildings were included in the trail. Otley Hall was naturally included and is detailed elsewhere. On the route is High House this is a 16th century house held by the Gosnolds from 1572 to 1615. Church House dates from 1540 . It has an ornate beam said to be the rood-beam ktaken from the church and which should have been destroyed. St Mary's Church is a small 13th century churc h. Netherhall, Otley Bottoms probably dating to the 15th century . Connections with the Gosnolds are plenty especially 1483/4. Grange Farm Otley already mentioned in the Farm Project.
